translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Section with Ones
The Elder Ambapiṇḍika’s Birth Story
“At that time I was a king of elephants,
with tusks like a spear and a large body;
while wandering in the Great Forest,
I saw the Leader of the World.
Taking a handful of mango fruit,🔽I gave it to the Teacher;
the Great Hero,
the Leader of the World, Siddhattha, accepted it.
While I was reflecting,
the Victorious One ate it then;
having inspired my mind there,
I was reborn in Tusita.
After I passed away from there,
I was a Wheel-turning Monarch;
by this very method,
having experienced perfection,
I was intent on striving,
peaceful, without possessions;
having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
For ninety-four aeons
the fruit I gave then;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
My pollutants are destroyed,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed was it for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four discriminations,🔽…
I have done the Teacher’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ambapiṇḍiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ambapiṇḍiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Elder Ambapālī recited these verses.
The Ninth Portion for Recital🔽The Story of the Elder Ambapālī is finished.
